Package org.neo4j.index.internal.gbptree

Class GenerationSafePointer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.neo4j.index.internal.gbptree.GenerationSafePointer
  • class GenerationSafePointer
extends Object
    Provides static methods for getting and manipulating GSP (generation-safe pointer) data. All interaction is made using a PageCursor. These methods are about a single GSP, whereas the normal use case of a GSP is in pairs (GSPP).

    A GSP consists of [generation,pointer,checksum]. Checksum is calculated from generation and pointer.

    Due to how java has one a single return type and objects produce/is garbage the design of the methods below for reading GSP requires some documentation to be used properly:

    Caller is responsible for initially setting cursor offset at the start of the GSP to read, then follows a couple of calls, each advancing the cursor offset themselves:

    1. readGeneration(PageCursor)
    2. readPointer(PageCursor)
    3. verifyChecksum(PageCursor, long, long)

      • write

        static void write​(PageCursor cursor,
                  long generation,
                  long pointer)
        Writes GSP at the given offset, the two fields (generation, pointer) + a checksum will be written.
        Parameters:
        cursor - PageCursor to write into.
        generation - generation to write.
        pointer - pointer to write.

      • checksumOf

        static short checksumOf​(long generation,
                        long pointer)
        Calculates a 2-byte checksum from GSP data.
        Parameters:
        generation - generation of the pointer.
        pointer - pointer itself.
        Returns:
        a short which is the checksum of the generation-pointer.
